channel.title: Sports
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Sports, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: 'Frustrated' World Cup Winner Paul Pogba Suffers Injury Setback at Monaco
item.description: Monaco's CEO has admitted his frustrations over Paul Pogba's injury setbacks since the 2018 World Cup winner signed for the Ligue 1 club in June last ...

item.title: 2026 NFL Coaching/GM Tracker: Steelers Request First HC Interviews After Tomlin Departure
item.description: The coaching carousel for the 2026 offseason is about to get moving. Here are the latest news and rumors from around the NFL!

item.title: Falcons' Next Head Coach Odds: Kevin Stefanski Favored; Tomlin Long Shot
item.description: Could one of two former head coaches find their footing with the Falcons? Here's what the latest odds say.

item.title: Crystal Palace Defender Chris Richards Voted U.S. Soccer Male Player of Year
item.description: Chris Richards has been voted the U.S. Soccer Federation Male Player of the Year for 2025.

item.title: Alabama Legend Mark Ingram Inducted to College Football Hall of Fame
item.description: Legendary Alabama running back and star of FOX's "Big Noon Kickoff" Mark Ingram is now part of the College Football Hall of Fame.

item.title: QB Moore opts against draft, returning to Ducks
item.description: Oregon QB Dante Moore, who was projected as a top pick in the NFL draft, has decided to return to school for the 2026 season, he announced on ESPN's "...

item.title: Source: LHP Suarez, BoSox agree to 5-year deal
item.description: The Boston Red Sox have agreed to a five-year, $130 million deal with left-hander Ranger Suarez, a source told ESPN, confirming multiple reports.

item.title: Sources: Young to be out through All-Star break
item.description: New Wizards star Trae Young is still recovering from MCL and quad injuries on his right leg and will be re-evaluated after the All-Star break, sources...

item.title: Teams winning the MLB offseason so far -- and those that need to make a big move soon
item.description: Which clubs are ruling the winter -- and which have work to do before spring training?

item.title: NL Central urgency ratings: How much work each team still needs to do
item.description: It's been a busy winter in Chicago, Pittsburgh and St. Louis. The rest of the division? Not so much.
